channel.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
channel.description:
This thread will be used to share and discuss any potential candidates for the interview in the Mopar Monthly issue that will be published at the end of June. Notable points will be placed into the OP.
Current nominations for candidate:
[ul][li]Miss Silabsoft (x2)[/li] [li]Lin (x2)[/li] [li]Bowser Jr[/li] [li]Newty[/li][/ul]
Current questions:
[ul][li]What has been the most notable change in the past two years, and what do you think will change in the next two?[/li][/ul]

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

But this forum is very lazy. No one will submit questions, haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Ambokile:

I think it’ll be better in furure if we keep the candidate to ourselves. We could, instead, tell the forum what the topic of the interview is and let them give general questions.

Not like it even made a difference this time around.
What I like about giving the interview candidate’s name for is simply because then the forum members are able to submit questions that relate specifically to that person, such as ‘What was it like running the silab client?’
I see what you mean though, but I’ve come to realize that the forum members want to know who the interviewed person is.

Read full topic

I plan to send the questions over by the end of today.
What annoys me right now is how the members of the forum ask to be informed of who the interviewed person will be in order for them to suggest questions, and not one person has given one idea yet.

item.description:

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I think it’d be good to see where the candidate thinks the community’s come in the past, say, two years, and where they think it’ll be in the next two. I think we could phrase this as a very open question and in return get some interesting responses.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’m planning to have the questions be more focused around what the community wants to ask, as well as what we want to add in. Feel free to give me suggestions for any sort of questions you’d like to ask. Now that we have a ‘final four’ of who we plan to interview, it should be easier for you to decide what questions you’d like to see asked and answered.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Alright, so it’ll be a mix of both “general” questions and questions specifically for that person. I think that’s a good approach. I’ve edited the main post to include our current nominations, we’ll have to keep watch on them throughout the next few weeks to see how they act and see if anything influences our decisions.

I agree that Newty would be a good general candidate and I think Bowser would too. It’s rare to see anything non-political from the community so I think it could potentially be quite an interesting read. Although given Nowser’s views on the military I think we should keep Bowser and Newty as far apart as possible, haha.

Are you going to want help designing any of the questions? I wouldn’t mind giving a hand if you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

As you’ve seen when I interviewed Tom, I focused mainly on the administrative side of things when I presented my questions. The same goes for someone being interviewed who is known for being a developer. I’m still going to incorporate questions that lean more toward personal aspects, such as school life and what they might do for a living, etc etc.

My reason for nominating Newty is because he is enlisted in the military which is a good topic to ask questions on, as well as him being an allaround cool guy that I wouldn’t mind getting to know better. Before you say that I could just message him privately, one of my favorite parts of the interview setup, and something I hope to do more of, is getting to know the person and asking questions based on what they answer.
Good to see Silabsoft and Lin getting their vote. If you could edit the original post with those three (perhaps 4?) users to be listed, that’d be great.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:6, topic:521009”]There is no particular aim when it comes to interviewing. At the end of the day, it all comes down to how the interviewed person responds to the provided questions. When I am looking out for who to interview I take into account their personality and what they do here, which gives me a good idea of how they will respond to any potential questions I may ask of them.
I am open to suggestions of what standpoint (be it a serious or comedic, etc) to conduct this month’s interview from, so by all means please do provide input.[/quote]
Will you be changing the questions depending on the person and the aim of the interview? For example, asking programming/development questions to a developer, and not asking them to someone who isn’t interested in development?

Flame_:

My vote for who to interview stands between Silabsoft, Lin and Newty.

I’ll put my vote in for Silabsoft, Lin and Bowser Jr.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

There is no particular aim when it comes to interviewing. At the end of the day, it all comes down to how the interviewed person responds to the provided questions. When I am looking out for who to interview I take into account their personality and what they do here, which gives me a good idea of how they will respond to any potential questions I may ask of them.
I am open to suggestions of what standpoint (be it a serious or comedic, etc) to conduct this month’s interview from, so by all means please do provide input.

My vote for who to interview stands between Silabsoft, Lin and Newty.

Read full topic

item.title: Interview Candidate Discussion - June
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Tom:

It depends what you’re trying to achieve with this interview, if you take Krackkid for example, he isn’t a veteran contributor with extensive knowledge of the scene but rather a popular forum guy, who most people like. It’d be like interviewing a comedian, you don’t interview them because of their extensive knowledge in engineering but because of their persona, it’s a more relaxed experience with general questions, and entertaining answers. Whereas with somebody like Blakeman for example, you’d be more inclined to ask them about programming and RSPS, so it’s less about persona and more about core knowledge and expertise in the field.

Yeah, I agree. I’m not conducting the interview so I’m not the one to decide what this month’s aim is. If it’s a more serious interview with more development-based aims, then Silabsoft or Lin would be good. If it was about a likeable forum member who is popular, then Krackkid would be good. If it was for a serious conversation with a member who has controversial tendencies, Bowser Jr would be a good shout.

Tom:

The choice you have to make is whether you want to entertain your audience, or educate your audience. Obviously a mixture of both would potentially be possible, but somebody with the professionalism of Blakeman doesn’t really have the same effect krackkid does on the community. I’m biased in my selection, simply because I would knock people who would use this opportunity give extreme and unfair answers, which would cause controversy. My concern about the interviews has always been that people looking to cause trouble can discredit the community, so I do hope there is a certain level of approval stopping people from answering with “This community is shit, the staff are horrible, all join my brothers community at http://badsite.com and get mod” after all this is homepage content.

The interview will be vetted. If they’re an idiot then it simply won’t be passed in and we’ll either get an interview before the publishing, or we’ll just not have an interview for that month.

Read full topic
